Have had a lot going on in my life recently (who hasnt!?), which also included recently experience rather severe loss of appetite and insomnia.  Doctor says its anxiety, but im avoiding anti-anxiety medication as I feel its too addictive a substance for my interest.  The insomnia has kept me up to between 5am-8am everyday for the last two weeks, which isnt so bad since i do still get a good 3-4 hours sleep.  Our roof on our home has been experience multiple leaks during this intense winter, and so we made the $10K investment to have our roof redone.  Sadly, i forgot that would all begin today Monday the 10th.  So while i was laying in bed at 7am I was greeted with the distinct voice of a bunch of bearish construction workers arriving.  About fourty minutes into their work I realized i wont be sleep in sadly till tonight, as my room is the first to have its roof removed.  Its like an earthquake, i feel every hammer/jab/scrape they are performing.

Still in a healthy relationship, we hit two years on valentines day - very much so my longest relationship.  Work ended abruptly when i was denied my right to file a claim of harrassment associated to my coworker to my supervisor.  Because of this all i have to support my claims is a osha violation i filed over the phone.  Looking for new employment but between my fathers care and my own issues ive found myself mostly paralyzed by fear.  I hermit myself into my room and rarely leave now, its disgusting that its come to this.

Hope life is being generous to you all~

So, who else expects younger generations to hate republicans now that a huge amount of blame is getting pointed at them as having cost the economy 24 billion over this 16 day shut down.  It felt a lot like angry kids taking their ball and going home until all their friends told them theyd never talk to them again.

Anyway, what was nuts to me was the stenographer who stood up and accused congress of being a bunch of satan worshipping free masons.  I certainly havent fed myself the conspiracy that free masons are satan worshippers... but i do have a free mason hall near me where they openly say hateful things to minorities and visually homosexual couples.  Had been told to "go back to gods land faggots" by an old couple when i walked past holding my boyfriends hand.  And now that we got a few indian families ,,,,walking through Hatboro with their kids ive listened to the free masons complain about "the smelly indian slaves" at the train station next to the mason hall.  But i always just attributed it to the idea that old caucasian people are just horrible human beings, and free masons arent any different.

A shame though, i really do feel like this whole shut down is going to throw the uneducated into the arms of the democrats.  And you know in the future youll hear people argue politics while saying "yeah but the republicans caused over a million people to work for free for 16 days and had 800,000 employees lose work for 16 days costing the economy 24 billion." 

Maybe people will discuss cheerful things like... jesus what is even cheerful anymore? XD

Not a human, but this companion meant -a lot- to me.  Yesterday I had to take my sugar glider to the vet, he had gangrene in his hindlegs where he got trapped in his pouch and circulation was cut off.  He didn't bark for help, he hid because if  he made noise a predator would come kill him... that's instict.

It was  offered to amputate limbs and try to recoop but the cost of the surgery and the upkeep  was well out oof my price range... so I was forced to put my companion of five years to sleep.  I sobbed all day, I'm holding back tears even now.  He was buried in a leather box I had from jewelery, and I put my picture and a note in it for him... he mattered so much to me that all I can do is regret not caring for him like he deserved.  If I could have afforded the surgery today my friend would be alive, I feel nothing but inadaquette now.  

I'm sure time will heal my wound, but he was mine - I lived out of my home when I got him, I cared for him, no one ever helped me.  I loved Ryuu.  I always will.

Goodbye my dear friend.

PAW@F

PA's"Weekend @ Furries”


What is PAW@F?

PAW@F is designed to be a regional weekend furmeet held every month, except when there is another major event close by.

 

When is PAW@F?

Every 2nd Friday of the Month, starting on February 11th, 2011.

 

Where is PAW@F?

The first few meets will be located in York, PA. About an hour drive North of Baltimore; Philadelphia is about 75 to 90 minutes to the East; and Pittsburgh is about 3.5 hours to the West.

 

Who is hosting PAW@F?

The meets will be held at Chrono's apartment, and will be hosted by him and his roommates: Sorin the Thylacine, and BrendanRoo.

 

What is there to do?

Food, Video Games (PS3/XBox360/Wii), Home Theater (50” HD Plasma/Surround Sound/Movies), Board Games (Munchkin/Hero Quest/etc), Other Furs (Talk/Hang Out/ect).

These meets will largely be modeled after WolfJ's old meets back near Philadelphia.


I have to drive from a long distance, is there crash space?

Like all things, crash space is limited so PLEASE RSVP ahead of time and let me know if you plan to crash here or not. Space is offered as a first come/first serve item. Additionally, there are numerous very cheap hotels and motels in the area. To save some time I've added them to this list.

 

Are there rules we should be aware of or age restriction?

Yes, this is a 18+ only party. That means you should be old enough to buy cigarettes on your own. Additionally, you will be in someone's apartment, any behavior that might cause Chrono to get evicted from his apartment should be done far away from his apartment. Drinking is allowed in moderation and only for those of legal age. During the “active” hours of the party behavior is expected to stay PG/R rated. After “lights out”, people are expect to behave in a appropriate of house guest. At any point, if you are making unwelcome advances towards people, you will be asked to leave. The simple rules of thumb are if you don't think you should be doing something... you probably shouldn't. Absolutely No Drugs, alcohol in moderation (after dinner only!), and respect others - these rules will be enforced.

 

Is there a place to smoke?

Yes, Chrono's apartment is furnished with a balcony for smokers. Please close the door behind you. :3

Friday, February 11th, 2011 (6:30pm until late) – Housewarming :3

We know this weekend clashes with FWA and so we hope if you are not attending the convention you could come spend an evening with some fuzzy friends like ourselves! Chrono has been living out in York for almost 5 years and never got to have a proper housewarming. So come help him celebrate by bringing snacks and drinks.

Basic Itinerary: Hanging out, Dinner at a local eatery, Movies/Games

Saturday, February 12th, 2011 (morning until afternoon)

Basic Itinerary: Breakfast, Afternoon Bowling or a Movie Matinee, back to the apartment and time to clean up.


What are some of the local hotel/motels?

(Some of these are available as cheaply as $30 a night, call ahead)

Please be sure to RSVP as space is limited using the
following sign-up site: http://m.anyvite.com/events/home/phzzc45dbh


Questions please contact Chrono at Chronocoon@GMail.com

I am thankful for all the nice people I've been blessed to meet and associate with over the years, and all the joy they have brought me.  

I am thankful for my father supporting me through the best and the worst, and my brother for being there as well.

I am thankful for my school and kung fu family for helping me mature and grow, learn, and evolve as a human being.

I am thankful that my willpower remained strong all the way up until today and allowed me to not communicate with my mom almost all year.

I am unthankful for the horrible thanksgiving I have endured with my mother, and all the pain sadness and misery I was forced to relive in a matter of minutes while in her presence.  I am sorry that my thanksgiving was ruined and taken from me as what used to be a pleasant holiday... and now will be remembered as the day I finally was able to accept ill never have a mother again.

I am thankful no one has to see me like this.

Happy Thanksgiving.

Howdy!  You still read my journal?  THANK YOU!

Alright on a serious note I want to give special thanks to everyone on staff at MFF this weekend for giving me the opportunity to come back and help.  I was alarmed to find I am apparently the youngest member on staff o.o

All you great people who gave up your time to make this weekend happen for folks: Thank you.

In the end I think the convention went really well for its con goers, and I think staff managed to survive in the end.  Sadly I had to leave before the stafff and volunteer dinner tonight but I don't mind because in the end I feel really good.

A pretty young girl had issues with her parking saturday, I continued to look into it for her and in the end couldn't even get her a refund but she shook my hand and told me with such passion "thank you so much, your the only person who even seemed to care about my problem.  Thank you so much for caring."  I was touched, and suddenly felt guilty for complaining that I was working as much as I was...  even if she was the only person who was helped by me this weekend its enough for me.

It wasn't a vacation, but I don't regret it at all.

Well time for your regularly scheduled update!  I learned this week that weathermen are very mean - they lie and say we will get another big storm and instead I get disapointment.

In other news, my grandfather broke his hip.  This happened two weeks ago, but no one found out till this week because my mom kept him restrained and away from a phone so he couldn't call for help.  She knew that if he went in the hospital for recovery shed be homeless.  So instead of making sure her FATHER was properly cared for she hid him until her brother found out.  Now grandpa is in the hospital, and mom is looking at being homeless.

I only found out because of a drunken assault my mom tried to committ at a bar ending in police contacting me.  So I investigated in my family and found out the full deal.  Holy fuck that's shitty.

Father went to hospital finally, now its been daily doctor and cardiologist visits as he recovers.  Been cooking for him and taking care of all his errands.  He appreciates it, and I use it as a test of my patience.

Kung-fu has been going well, steady increase in adult students - though I did lose a pair of kids (brothers).  Been doing Bot Chom Doh vs Luk Dim Poon Kwan training - good times.

Enjoyable Moment: while gaming at a local hobbystore a kid came in and his mother shortly followed, it was apparent the kid had his mom on a leash. Well its updating time again, and ill go the standard route of starting with the bad and finishing with the good.

My father went in for heart surgery again, they were fixing the debocle that was the last surgery.  Things went smoothly, he was out of recovery in 24 hours.  I've been with him the whole way, so I have been caring for him the entire trip... until we got home.  

He asked for me to let him walk, so I turned around and WHAM! He dropped like a ton of bricks and busted his fake hip on the cement.  Its been three full days of agonizing torture since than as he's moaned cried and whaled over the agony, but refuses to see a doctor or go to the hospital.

Many interviws have come and gone, no job yet - resume is actively being considered at least.  

Kung fu goes well, only poo poo part was eating at a place that was like aladdins palace and everyone ate with their hands... out of the same dish... yuck.

No snow recently!  YAY!   Too much snow this winter for me, so ill cherrish the lack of it recently.  Also Warhammer 40K has been in big boom lately :) so hooray for that!

Random Shout Out:
-Hi Berin greenbear :D your gonna be a spectactular papa bear!

-Littlewolf & Skippyfox!  Pork Chop Sandwiches!

When I was a child, id act a certain way - but when someone claimed I acted another way id do so to spite them.  This was called being immature.

As an adult (mostly adult... kinda) I see people do the same thing all the time.  Especially, when online in internet communication or things like xbox chat.  People will release all concepts of mature communication to replace it with the most child like options availble including: yelling into your microphone nonsensically so that someone else can't speak, or simply continue to blabber over someone else to avoid letting them "give their perspective".

If you tried that in real life, someone would have broken your smile into a crackhead suck hole.  So what makes people feel they should make such communication their focus?  

Lack of morals?  Or maybe just lack of interest in holding what might have been an educational conversation with oneof the parties involved.  But id assume more so a lack of moral will & moral skill.

The moral skill to determine the difference between right & wrong, and the moral will to take actions to adhere to what's right instead of breeding what's wrong.

Sometimes its better to walk away, but I can't help but feel I missed an opportunity to better understand someones point of view... but I can't force them to be an adult.

Cest le ve.

Hope your all ready for a big snow storm :)

P.S. Posting this was pretty immature too, so shame on me for doing so.  Still have aninsanely bitter taste in my mouth about it, especialy after trying to gain understanding through further discussion.

I totally slacked off on updating which im very sorry about doing.  Let me give you guys a bit of an update to what's been going on.

1. My dad seems to be doing okay, he can't lift things for himself but day to day he seems okay.  
2. My roommate was taken to the emergency room today to be checked out after some intense stomach pains.  Turned out he just has some GI bug going around and severe abdominal cramping.
3. My mother went batshit insane and claimed Dee (the gentleman I mentioned before who may be joining my school and cut his finger off for my mom) had raped her.  She said she was screaming but my granddad couldn't hear her, I don't believe her but... I dunno.  Other drama as well, family falling to pieces otherwise besides my brother and father.  Wild shit let me tell you.

Me?  Im doing alright, talking with Quest Diagnostics about customer service work, they are the most prospectful lead I have for work.  My health is great, and my day to day life is bearable.  Working on many different 40k projects, will be posting my pictures of an event in the next 48 hours.

Hope all you furries out in california enjoy your convention, and a shout out to my good friend Frank Ransom.  Frank is a philosophy student whom I've been friends with for many years, he's good people - and one of my few friends who keep up with this journal IRL :)

Good eve'!

Well I was sick for the last week roughly with some sinus infection/flu thingy.  It wasn't that bad until last night - I was heading to the bathroom to grab tissue to blow my nose.  My brother had been kind enough to leave heavy objects strewn about the floor before he went to bed in the hall way.

I stubbed my right foot onto one of said objects, ignored it, and went back to sleep.  This morning I can't move my little toe or the toe next to it, and my foot is swollen.  As the street sharks say "Totally Jawsome!"

Well, there goes any training or traveling for me for a while.

KungfuDave, over & out!

I now have slept, and decided a thank you post was in order.  Though my weekend had its bumps and bruises I think many people deserve thanks and if I don't say them ill regret it :)

DaveQat: thank you so much for everything, from driving me from the airport to the hotel early morning friday to provided me a shoulder to rest on when needed.

Cicero/Reddywhip: for doing that voodoo that you do so well >:)~

Cryptowolf: I don't even think you read my LJ, but you were awesome at Megaplex and now you were a real mench at MFF.  You worked countless hours, kept up with wonderful conversation, and always kept a posative attitude - we were blessed to have your help.  I was very lucky to meet someone so generous with their time, and of course thank you for seeing me off to the airport sunday.

Gadget/Pouncer: don't think you two read here either, but you two put up with me and my bitterness - while simultaniously conquering every task placed before you.  You two beside crypto and carl acted as the cornerstones that made volunteering a success this year.  You guys also love the same anime as me so <3

Roby Panther!: because he's a total sweetheart, like really - he's one of a dieing breed so you single folks better hunt him down.  Brought me his left over chinese for dinner saturday, it was the only food outside of con provided snacks and the one breakfest I had by myself.  Not to mention he was going to work for me if I needed, and he attended a panel with me *wag*  it was nice.

Sevenwolf: for providing me space to room in, and all your hard work at the con.

Duncan D Husky & Takaza: though you guys already heard it lots, I must say it again - you two are wonderful for all your hard work.  Im a sap, I totally cried with you when you were given your plague ;)

Furp: I met many people who were honoring your memory, as well as seeing your mother about the con.  I came this year to support the con, but when I was down and questioning my decisions id just think about what you'd told me last year.  I still think about you, and im sure others do as well.  I hope somewhere im lucky enough that your seeing how everyone feels.

Spikedpunch & Silverlonewolf: for keeping me company, offering to bring me things, being generally silly, and of course letting me talk warhammer at you *wag*

Snowie & Elipsis: as if you guys need a reason for me to thank you, cause your so overflowing with awesome thanks just spill out on the streets for you both. But seriously, thank you so much for spending time with me and trying to find me for dinner sunday.  The thought really does count :)

And what I will admit to be the most important thanks:

Perro & Wolphy: guys, I know I told thanks in my last post - and I hope I did at con as well, but thank you so much.  Toby managed to lift my spirits with two sentances, one commenting on my looks (im so vain!) and the other my efforts.  It never ceases to amaze me how one man stepping up and showing you his appreciation can make you forget your woes.  Wolphy?  For being the sweetie who made sure I felt loved, and made sure I never felt like I was doing it for nothing... infact on those grounds 2 new names join this special thanks spot:

Charlesbear and Vish:  because both of you went out of your way to socialize with me and make me feel appreciated as well, from hugs to jokes - and even belly pokes.



Well, im unsure what ill do about MFF 2010 - whether ill enjoy it or not kinda doesn't matter.  Furp told me to help others like he did me, and I plan to honor that - so I think ill keep up my efforts for MFF as long as they'll have me.

Lastly but most needed: every single gopher who aided MFF, thank you for every minute you spared from your convention experience to help us make it a great one for everyone else - we can't do it without you.

Have a good day everyone, and if your traveling home today be safe.

Well im sitting at a hotel waiting for my shuttle to the airport, had spent most of the night struggling to sleep cause I was so anxious to get to see someone this weekend.  Like magic, this person was booted out of the convention lastnight and was barred from returning.  So at 4:45 I feel like im going to vomit while I sit here.

Most of the people I go to MFF to see aren't going, they dislike the hotel staff/hotel itself and don't see a value in spending the money to deal with them.  Over the past two months I went from having a dozen people I was anxious to see.... to having 3.  Than lastnight it was slumped down to 2.

Many others it'll be nice to see, but now im left with this big hole in my gut that tells me this is a huge mistake - so I sure hope my weekend turns out better than the clues are saying.  The person im rooming with is Seven Wolf, but I haven't spoken to him in a long while so I hope my room is still secure :(  the man they kicked out of the con was a friend who was going to be nice enough to let me room with him if my room fell through.

So now I wait to fly to chicago, maybe have no room, but definitely not have the guy I was supposed to take out for beers and catch up after years of seperation.

If someone pulls the fire alarm this year, im going to choke slam someone.

Good afternoon readers!

Well its been an alright week, been helping my dad day to day and working on my Daemon Hunter army for Warhammer 40k.  This weekend is a mix of plans which are slowly becoming a wash for me sadly.

Last night was bear night at the Bike Stop in philadelphia so i went with snowie and soxpup - I was fed lots of beer (by my standards) and stood shirtless in a bar.  New experience for meeeee~

We went to IHOP and stuff, I got home around 3:30 and had to wake up by 7.  Ugh. :D
Definitely wanna go back with snowie more though, she even had been social enough that the bartender knew her by name!

Today I taught class, and I did my morning work out...my hang over won and I vomitted tons.  So I ditched training and went home for a nap.  Was going to go to the FA: United meeting today in Mt. Laurel, so I packed the car and hit the road.  I was a mile away from the interstate when my dad called, he fell down the stairs and needed me to be home to care for him...

So now im home, he's in bed medicated and asleep, and im wondering if next week will work out or if ill get called at MFF about my Dad.

Well, I guess ill go play Dragon Age and come check on my dad again in 30min.  Shawn if you read this im sorry I missed the meeting, your still awesome for buying lunch for everyone!

Have a nice weekend guys & gals

Well today was the first day of the 2009 Mechanicon warhammer 40k grand tournament.  The entrance fee is $120, you play 5 battles against one of the many opponents and score points towards your end ranking.  Each army is 1850 points, I decided to join as Chaos Daemons (Nurgle/Khorne/Slaanesh).

I arrived at 10am, it started at 9... they never gave timing info out :( so I forfeit my first round and get 0 points.  

Second round I play Imperial Guard, I do well but my greater daemon died to a rules error... and she was blowing up tanks every turn after the first.  But im a good sport and kept up the 40k spirit the whole time.  

Third round I face salamanders chapter of space marines, though they were painted as possessed iron legion.  I lost as I had a mission 2 sheet, everyone else had mission 3... I played to the wrong mission objectives :(   Lots of people commented after they didn't understand what I was doing... I wish someone just spoke up instead of watching me play a different battle for 6 rounds.

Tomorrow I go back for my final two rounds, but over all im really dissapointed in this grand tournament.  The modeled armies are nice, but the rules F up really hurt - followed up by mission F up... felt like crap.  Hopefully tomorrow ill enjoy my games more, the big thing is I keep trying to seem friendly and happy regardless.  Im pushing to get a "good sportsman" trophey LOL

Moral victory for the win?

IN OTHER NEWS: Spikedpunch chatted with me afterwards and it helped me feel much better.

Slaanesh commands you to commit horrible acts upon yourself in a pseudo-sexual fashion... so get on top of that? :)

Have a good weekend guys, if you read this far into my battle report kudos to you!
